trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send push notifications to users in Azure. Code samples written in Java for Android
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send push notifications to users in Azure. Code samples written in Java for Android

trans-unit.source: Push notification support in Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.
trans-unit.target: Push notification support in Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a specific app user on a specific device.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a specific app user on a specific device.

trans-unit.source: An ASP.NET WebAPI backend is used to authenticate clients and to generate notifications, as shown in the guidance topic <linkText>Registering from your app backend</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: An ASP.NET WebAPI backend is used to authenticate clients and to generate notifications, as shown in the guidance topic <linkText>Registering from your app backend</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial builds on the notification hub that you created in the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Android)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial builds on the notification hub that you created in the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Android)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Android)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Android)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Mobile Services as your backend service, see the <linkText>Mobile Services version</linkText><title></title> of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Mobile Services as your backend service, see the <linkText>Mobile Services version</linkText><title></title> of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The next step is to create the Android application.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to create the Android application.

trans-unit.source: Follow the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Android)</linkText><title></title> tutorial to create and configure your app to receive push notifications from GCM.
trans-unit.target: Follow the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Android)</linkText><title></title> tutorial to create and configure your app to receive push notifications from GCM.

trans-unit.source: Open your res/layout/activity_main.xml file, replace the with the following content definitions.
trans-unit.target: Open your res/layout/activity_main.xml file, replace the with the following content definitions.

trans-unit.source: This adds new EditText controls for logging in as a user.
trans-unit.target: This adds new EditText controls for logging in as a user.

trans-unit.source: Also a field is added for a username tag that will be part of notifications you send:
trans-unit.target: Also a field is added for a username tag that will be part of notifications you send:

trans-unit.source: Open your res/values/strings.xml file and replace the send_button definition with the following lines that redefine the string for the send_button and add strings for the other controls:
trans-unit.target: Open your res/values/strings.xml file and replace the send_button definition with the following lines that redefine the string for the send_button and add strings for the other controls:

trans-unit.source: Your main_activity.xml graphical layout should now look like this:
trans-unit.target: Your main_activity.xml graphical layout should now look like this:

trans-unit.source: Create a new class named RegisterClient in the same package as your MainActivity class.
trans-unit.target: Create a new class named RegisterClient in the same package as your MainActivity class.

trans-unit.source: Use the code below for the new class file.
trans-unit.target: Use the code below for the new class file.

trans-unit.source: This component implements the REST calls required to contact the app backend, in order to register for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This component implements the REST calls required to contact the app backend, in order to register for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: It also locally stores the registrationIds created by the Notification Hub as detailed in Registering from your app backend.
trans-unit.target: It also locally stores the registrationIds created by the Notification Hub as detailed in Registering from your app backend.

trans-unit.source: Note that it uses an authorization token stored in local storage when you click the Log in button.
trans-unit.target: Note that it uses an authorization token stored in local storage when you click the Log in button.

trans-unit.source: In your MainActivity class remove or comment out your private field for NotificationHub, and add a field for the RegisterClient class and a string for your ASP.NET backend's endpoint. Be sure to replace with the your actual backend endpoint obtained previously. For example, http://mybackend.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: In your MainActivity class remove or comment out your private field for NotificationHub, and add a field for the RegisterClient class and a string for your ASP.NET backend's endpoint. Be sure to replace with the your actual backend endpoint obtained previously. For example, http://mybackend.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: In your MainActivity class, in the onCreate method, remove or comment out the initialization of the hub field and the call to the registerWithNotificationHubs method.
trans-unit.target: In your MainActivity class, in the onCreate method, remove or comment out the initialization of the hub field and the call to the registerWithNotificationHubs method.

trans-unit.source: Then add code to initialize an instance of the RegisterClient class.
trans-unit.target: Then add code to initialize an instance of the RegisterClient class.

trans-unit.source: The method should contain the following lines:
trans-unit.target: The method should contain the following lines:

trans-unit.source: In your MainActivity class, delete or comment out the entire registerWithNotificationHubs method.
trans-unit.target: In your MainActivity class, delete or comment out the entire registerWithNotificationHubs method.

trans-unit.source: It will not be used in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: It will not be used in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Add the following import statements to your MainActivity.java file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following import statements to your MainActivity.java file.

trans-unit.source: Then, add the following methods to handle the Log in button click event and sending push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Then, add the following methods to handle the Log in button click event and sending push notifications.

trans-unit.source: The login handler for the Log in button generates a basic authentication token using on the input username and password (note that this represents any token your authentication scheme uses), then it uses RegisterClient to call the backend for registration.
trans-unit.target: The login handler for the Log in button generates a basic authentication token using on the input username and password (note that this represents any token your authentication scheme uses), then it uses RegisterClient to call the backend for registration.

trans-unit.source: The sendPush method calls the backend to trigger a secure notification to the user based on the user tag.
trans-unit.target: The sendPush method calls the backend to trigger a secure notification to the user based on the user tag.

trans-unit.source: The platform notification service that sendPush targets depends on the pns string passed in.
trans-unit.target: The platform notification service that sendPush targets depends on the pns string passed in.

trans-unit.source: In your MainActivity class, update the sendNotificationButtonOnClick method to call the sendPush method with the user's selected platform notification services as follows.
trans-unit.target: In your MainActivity class, update the sendNotificationButtonOnClick method to call the sendPush method with the user's selected platform notification services as follows.

trans-unit.source: Run the application on a device or an emulator using Android Studio.
trans-unit.target: Run the application on a device or an emulator using Android Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the Android app, enter a username and password.
trans-unit.target: In the Android app, enter a username and password.

trans-unit.source: They must both be the same string value and they must not contain spaces or special characters.
trans-unit.target: They must both be the same string value and they must not contain spaces or special characters.

trans-unit.source: In the Android app, click Log in.
trans-unit.target: In the Android app, click Log in.

trans-unit.source: Wait for a toast message that states Logged in and registered.
trans-unit.target: Wait for a toast message that states Logged in and registered.

trans-unit.source: This will enable the Send Notification button.
trans-unit.target: This will enable the Send Notification button.

trans-unit.source: Click the toggle buttons to enable all platforms where you have ran the app and registered a user.
trans-unit.target: Click the toggle buttons to enable all platforms where you have ran the app and registered a user.

trans-unit.source: Enter the user's name that will receive the notification message.
trans-unit.target: Enter the user's name that will receive the notification message.

trans-unit.source: That user must be registered for notifications on the target devices.
trans-unit.target: That user must be registered for notifications on the target devices.

trans-unit.source: Enter a message for the user to receive as a push notification message.
trans-unit.target: Enter a message for the user to receive as a push notification message.

trans-unit.source: Click Send Notification.
trans-unit.target: Click Send Notification.

trans-unit.source: Each device that has a registration with the matching username tag will receive the push notification.
trans-unit.target: Each device that has a registration with the matching username tag will receive the push notification.
